column4: So you can ping gateway and DNS server but not google.com, correct? What does 'route' give?
correct, pinging google resolves the ip but thats it. default's gateway is correct in route
Can you confirm internet is working on another box on same network?
i set up the wireless card with static ip configuration following some online instructions, its not far off from wired configuration
do so just to make sure
what kind of environment, home network with DHCP router?
it works fine. the gateway i am trying to use is a windows server with internet connection sharing, network uses static ips
Well, it does if done correctly ;) It will probably be a "Ahh!"
as i said, i have configured ubuntu server manually tons of times in the past, this seems like a bug.
Ok? I got it wrong then, thought you said DNS was ok?
So no traffic whatsoever outside of LAN?
the dns server is the same windows box that is the gateway, it resolves addresses to ips fine, but ping received no response
Don't you have any logs in the gateway box that might reveal what's going on?
Or maybe /var/log/syslog might have something on Ubuntu box?
